intro: Agalinis tenuifolia var. leucanthera, commonly known as the whitestem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The flowers are typically pale pink to white in color and are arranged in whorls along the stem. This variety is distinguished by its white flowers, which contrast with the more commonly found pink or red flowers in other varieties of Agalinis tenuifolia. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
